alert.note: Alert for Union (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 24 at 7:19PM EDT until July 24 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The following counties, in Central Ohio, Delaware and Union OH. * WHEN...Until 915 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 719 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in New Dover, Bellepoint, Delaware and Lewis Center. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Columbus, Dublin, Westerville, Delaware, Marysville, Powell, Sunbury, Polaris, New California, Shawnee Hills, Galena, Ostrander, Stratford, Lewis Center, Alum Creek State Park, Columbus Zoo, Bellepoint, Interstate 71 at US Route 36/State Route 37, State Route 257 at US Route 36 and Warrensburg.
info.instruction: Keep children away from storm drains, culverts, creeks and streams. Water levels can rise rapidly and sweep children away. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
